Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

::Firaxis::
       In the vastness of space there are many entities beyond the 
comprehension of any other living thing, but that is irrelevant.  Somewhere 
else in the afore mentioned vastness there is a hole through space and time.  
Near this hole there is a planet.  Rather there was a planet, well, that's 
not exactly true either.  The planet is still there in that there's a planet 
sized rock floating around through space in the planet's orbit.  But the 
planet is barren and devoid of all life that once lived upon it.  Admittedly 
this consisted of one Cybertronian and his dog.  Sadly someone found this 
Cybertronian who had once been a high class mercenary and was very confused 
as to why a Cybertronian had a dog, not to mention how the dog survived on a 
planet devoid of oxygen and food.  Nonplused the man paid him to kill his dog 
and then left after seeing the dog die.

       With nothing left to bind him to the planet the Cybertronian, Firaxis, 
got back into his shuttle and flew through the same tunnel he had used to get 
here. He needed another dog.  Unfortunately due to a slight miscalculation 
and a wrong turn near the 1900s he ended up in orbit around the correct 
planet.  You're probably wondering what's so unfortunate about that, the 
unfortunate part is that there were no dogs yet.  He had arrived several 
million years too early.  He knew this because he scanned the planet from 
orbit and came up with a considerable lack of dogs.  On the other hand his 
scanners did pick up Maximals, Predacons, Autobots, and Decepticons.  "It's 
been a while since I've had a good war to play in, maybe I should offer my 
services."  He taps a few controls and opens a channel to the planet.  "Hi, 
I'm Firaxis.  I'm a mercenary.  The first group to contact me with an offer 
that includes a dog will gain my services until I receive a better offer.  I 
will complete any mission assigned before I change my allegiance, however.  
Have a nice day.  I'll be waiting to hear from you."  He smiles and turns of 
the communications device.  He sets the ship in orbit and doses off.  He'd 
check his responses when he wakes up and pick one at random, as long as he 
got a dog.

--part1_94.23223606.29c6b95e_boundary
Content-Type: text/html; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

<HTML><FONT FACE=arial,helvetica><FONT  SIZE=2>::Firaxis::
<BR>       In the vastness of space there are many entities beyond the comprehension of any other living thing, but that is irrelevant.  Somewhere else in the afore mentioned vastness there is a hole through space and time.  Near this hole there is a planet.  Rather there was a planet, well, that's not exactly true either.  The planet is still there in that there's a planet sized rock floating around through space in the planet's orbit.  But the planet is barren and devoid of all life that once lived upon it.  Admittedly this consisted of one Cybertronian and his dog.  Sadly someone found this Cybertronian who had once been a high class mercenary and was very confused as to why a Cybertronian had a dog, not to mention how the dog survived on a planet devoid of oxygen and food.  Nonplused the man paid him to kill his dog and then left after seeing the dog die.
<BR>
<BR>       With nothing left to bind him to the planet the Cybertronian, Firaxis, got back into his shuttle and flew through the same tunnel he had used to get here. He needed another dog.  Unfortunately due to a slight miscalculation and a wrong turn near the 1900s he ended up in orbit around the correct planet.  You're probably wondering what's so unfortunate about that, the unfortunate part is that there were no dogs yet.  He had arrived several million years too early.  He knew this because he scanned the planet from orbit and came up with a considerable lack of dogs.  On the other hand his scanners did pick up Maximals, Predacons, Autobots, and Decepticons.  "It's been a while since I've had a good war to play in, maybe I should offer my services."  He taps a few controls and opens a channel to the planet.  "Hi, I'm Firaxis.  I'm a mercenary.  The first group to contact me with an offer that includes a dog will gain my services until I receive a better offer.  I will complete any mission assigned before I change my allegiance, however.  Have a nice day.  I'll be waiting to hear from you."  He smiles and turns of the communications device.  He sets the ship in orbit and doses off.  He'd check his responses when he wakes up and pick one at random, as long as he got a dog.</FONT></HTML>
